sections.title: Overview
sections.content: The build conformance defines how Hologram components are compiled, tested, and packaged. It supports multiple build systems and provides a consistent interface for build operations.

sections.title: Build Types
sections.content: Supported build types include: docker (containerized builds), make (Makefile-based), npm (Node.js), cargo (Rust), go (Go modules), gradle/maven (Java), and script (custom scripts).

sections.title: Build Steps
sections.content: Build steps are executed sequentially. Each step has a name, command, optional working directory, environment variables, and conditional execution rules.

sections.title: Artifacts
sections.content: Build artifacts are categorized as binaries (executables), libraries (shared/static libs), documentation (generated docs), and schemas (generated schemas). These are preserved after the build completes.

sections.title: Caching
sections.content: Build caching can be enabled to speed up subsequent builds. Cache keys can include checksums of dependency files to ensure cache invalidation on changes.
